medical_history.chief_complaint: Lower-extremity length inequality and knee extension lag due to patellar tendon aplasia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The boy presented with a limp due to lower extremity length inequality, with the left lower limb being shorter than the right. The presentation included an active extension lag of 20° to 35° noted during annual examinations since the age of two months, with worsening to 40° at examination prior to surgery. No patellar tendon was palpable, and there was a compensatory flexion contracture of the hip and ankle.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with a knee flexion contracture due to an arthrogryposis-like disorder at six months of age, characterized by multiple joint contractures. Prior medical history included severe maternal hypertension and eclampsia during pregnancy, leading to cesarean delivery at 10 weeks prior to term.
medical_history.family_history: Negative for musculoskeletal abnormalities; older brother is normal.
